description.narrative:
- Addressing BOP Needs: Suvidhaa will empower the Bottom of the Pyramid consumer segments by providing innovative access to services and payments solutions required to fulfill the services in a more efficient and convenient method which was not previously available. 35% of Suvidhaa's existing footprint in India is in the lower income states. The Company will further expand its reach through mobile applications.
- SME development: By having Suvidhaa outlets in the stores, the small retail store franchisees will be able to significantly increase the traffic of customers to their stores by leveraging the services and the brand name of Suvidhaa. These micro-SMEs will be able to increase approximately US$300 per month in revenue.

The proposed project consists of an equity investment in Suvidhaa Infoserve Private Limited (the Company or Suvidhaa) up to US$5 million to support the Company to expand its services in India. IFC is expected to invest in redeemable convertible preferred Series B shares.
The Company started its operation in 2007 and has enrolled 18,000 outlets in India to date. Suvidhaa, as a retail service aggregator, provides access to local services such as purchase of railway tickets, airline tickets, or mobile top-up, through its manned retail outlets with Suvidhaa application and PC. Suvidhaa outlets also serve as collection points for many services such as utility bills and insurance premium. The Company mainly targets the large bottom of the pyramid and non-internet savvy consumers who will benefit from the one-stop shopping including payment mechanism.
